category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 17 (Convocation of General Meeting)
contents: Article 17 (Convocation of general meeting) ① The regular general meeting shall be convened by the chairman within two months after the end of each fiscal year. ② The extraordinary general meeting shall be convened by the chairman within 15 days in any of the following cases. Revised April 2, 2018, 1. When the Chairman deems it necessary, 2. When a majority of registered directors request a convening by presenting the purpose of the meeting, 3. When more than one-third of registered delegates vote for the meeting. When a convening is requested by presenting the purpose; 4. When an auditor requests a convening in accordance with Article 27, Paragraph 4, Item 4 in relation to the field of duty; ③ Notwithstanding the provisions of Paragraph 2, Items 2 through 4, the Chairman If the general meeting is not convened within 15 days without a justifiable reason, the director, representative, and auditor who requested the convocation may convene the general meeting. ④ When convening a general meeting, the agenda, date, time, and location must be clearly recorded and notified to the delegates in writing (including electronic documents) at least 7 days prior to the meeting. However, if there are urgent reasons, the period may be shortened., ⑤ The general meeting may only decide on notified agenda items. However, if there is the approval of all delegates present, other agenda items may be submitted and resolved. ⑥ Except for the proviso to paragraph 7, the general meeting cannot be replaced by a written resolution. Revised July 5, 2021, ⑦ The general meeting shall be held in person in principle. However, if it is difficult to conduct a face-to-face meeting due to special circumstances such as infectious diseases or natural disasters, deliberation and resolution may be made through remote communication means or submission of written resolutions, and the necessary matters shall be determined separately. In this case, agenda items requiring closed or anonymous voting cannot be voted on. Newly established 2021. 3. 16., 2021. 7. 5.
